bill_title: revise certain provisions regarding the transportation, possession, purchase, and sale of certain endangered and threatened species of wildlife and to provide a penalty for violation of those provisions.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding the transportation, possession, purchase, and sale of certain endangered and threatened species of wildlife and to provide a penalty for violation of those provisions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34A-8-10 be amended to read as follows: 34A-8-10. A Except for black bear as provided in section 2 of this Act, any species of wildlife appearing on any of the lists enumerated in § 34A-8-9 may enter South Dakota from another state or from a point outside the territorial limits of the United States and may be transported, possessed, purchased, and sold in accordance with the terms of a permit issued pursuant to rules promulgated by the Game, Fish and Parks Commission pursuant to chapter 1- 26. It is a Class 2 misdemeanor to transport, possess, purchase, or sell any species of wildlife, except black bear, appearing on any of the lists enumerated in § 34A-8-9 without a permit or to violate the conditions of the permit. Section 2. That chapter 34A-8 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person may transport into South Dakota or otherwise possess within the state any black bear unless the black bear was lawfully taken or acquired in another state or from a point outside the territorial limits of the United States. No person may buy or sell the edible portions of the bear, the bear paws unless attached to the hide, or the gall bladder of any black bear. It is a Class 2 misdemeanor to transport, possess, purchase, or sell black bear, or any part thereof, in violation of the provisions of this section.
